strategy: Apply a recurrent neural network (RNN) with long short-term memory (LSTM) units to model the sequence of column player actions, using a sliding window of the last 15 rounds. Instead of attention-based context modeling, the LSTM captures temporal dynamics through internal state propagation, learning hidden representations that evolve over time based on observed behavior. The final hidden state is passed through a sigmoid layer to produce a cooperation probability. This approach leverages sequential memory dynamics to detect emerging behavioral trends, such as gradual shifts toward defection or cooperation, without relying on attention mechanisms or fixed-length windows.
